books.title: To Kill a Mockingbird
books.author: Harper Lee
books.summary: A novel about the serious issues of rape and racial inequality narrated by the young Scout Finch.

books.author: George Orwell
books.summary: A story of a dystopian future where totalitarian regime suppresses all dissent.

books.title: Pride and Prejudice
books.author: Jane Austen
books.summary: A classic novel of manners that explores the issues of marriage, money, and love.

books.title: The Great Gatsby
books.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
books.summary: A novel about the American dream and the downfall of those who attempt to reach its illusory goals.

books.title: Moby-Dick
books.author: Herman Melville
books.summary: A narrative of the adventures of the whaling ship Pequod, commanded by Captain Ahab who is obsessed with hunting the white whale Moby Dick.

books.title: War and Peace
books.author: Leo Tolstoy
books.summary: A historical novel that intertwines the lives of several families against the backdrop of the Napoleonic wars.

books.title: The Catcher in the Rye
books.author: J.D. Salinger
books.summary: A novel about teenage angst and alienation narrated by the disillusioned Holden Caulfield.

books.title: The Hobbit
books.author: J.R.R. Tolkien
books.summary: A fantasy novel about the journey of Bilbo Baggins, who sets off on an unexpected adventure with a group of dwarves to reclaim their homeland.

books.title: Crime and Punishment
books.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
books.summary: A novel exploring the moral dilemmas faced by a poor ex-student who plans to kill a pawnbroker for her money.

books.title: Jane Eyre
books.author: Charlotte BrontÃ«
books.summary: A novel about the experiences of the orphaned Jane Eyre, including her growth to adulthood and her love for Mr. Rochester.
